16/**
17 * @mainpage
18 *
19 * @section introduction Introduction
20 *
21 * `libsemver` is a C++ library with C bindings that provides the following
22 * functionality:
23 *
24 * - Parsing a version number into an object.
25 * - Comparing versions.
26 * - Modifying versions object.
27 *
28 * Versions are checked against _Semantic Versioning 2.0.0_
29 * (http://semver.org/).
30 *
31 * @section changelog Changelog
32 *
33 * See the @ref history "History" page.
34 *
35 * @section bindings Available Bindings
36 *
37 * `libsemver` is a C++ library with C bindings which makes it available to a
38 * wide range of programming languages. If a programming language has C
39 * bindings, then `libsemver` can be used from it. The C binding provides all
40 * the functionality provided by the C++ implementation and it can be used as a
41 * fallback solution when the C++ API cannot be used.
42 *
43 * @section libtools-versioning libtool's versioning scheme
44 *
45 * `libtool`'s versioning scheme is described by three integers:
46 * `current:revision:age` where:
47 *
48 * - `current` is the most recent interface number implemented by the
49 * library.
50 * - `revision` is the implementation number of the current interface.
51 * - `age` is the difference between the newest and the oldest interface that
52 * the library implements.
53 *
54 * @section bug-reports Reporting Bugs and Suggestions
55 *
56 * If you find problems or have suggestions about this program or this manual,
57 * please report them as new issues in the official GitHub repository at
58 * https://github.com/emcrisostomo/semver-utils. Please, read the
59 * `CONTRIBUTING.md` file for detailed instructions on how to contribute to
60 * `fswatch`.
61
62 */
63/**
64 * @page history History
65 *
66 * @section v600 1:0:0
67 *
68 * - Initial release.
69 */
70#include "version.hpp"
71
72#include <algorithm>
73#include <iostream>
74#include <iterator> // back_inserter
75#include <regex>
76
77namespace semver
78{
79 static std::vector<unsigned int> parse_version(const std::string &v);
80 static void match_prerelease(const std::string &s);
81 static void match_metadata(const std::string &s);
82 static void check_identifier(const std::string &s);
83 static const std::string PRERELEASE_PATTERN("([0-9A-Za-z-]+(\\.[0-9A-Za-z-]+)*)");
84 static const std::string METADATA_PATTERN("([0-9A-Za-z-]+(\\.[0-9A-Za-z-]+)*)");
85
86 prerelease_component::prerelease_component(std::string s) : identifier(std::move(s))
87 {
88 is_number = !identifier.empty() &&
89 std::find_if(identifier.begin(), identifier.end(), [](char c) { return !std::isdigit(c); }) == identifier.end();
90 value_as_number = is_number ? std::stoul(identifier) : 0;
91 }
92
93 bool prerelease_component::operator==(const prerelease_component &v) const
94 {
95 return identifier == v.identifier;
96 }
97
98 bool prerelease_component::operator<(const prerelease_component &rh) const
99 {
100 if (is_number && rh.is_number)
101 return value_as_number < rh.value_as_number;
102 if (!is_number && !rh.is_number)
103 return identifier < rh.identifier;
104 return is_number;
105 }
106
107 bool prerelease_component::operator>(const prerelease_component &rh) const
108 {
109 return (rh < *this);
110 }
111
112 version version::from_string(std::string v)
113 {
114 // SemVer 2.0.0
115 //
116 // 2. A normal version number MUST take the form X.Y.Z where X, Y, and Z are
117 // non-negative integers, and MUST NOT contain leading zeroes. [...]
118 //
119 // This implementation allows for a version number containing more than 3
120 // components.
121 const std::string version_pattern = "((0|[1-9][[:digit:]]*)(\\.(0|[1-9][[:digit:]]*)){1,})";
122 const int VERSION_INDEX = 1;
123
124 // 9. A pre-release version MAY be denoted by appending a hyphen and a series
125 // of dot separated identifiers immediately following the patch version.
126 // Identifiers MUST comprise only ASCII alphanumerics and hyphen
127 // [0-9A-Za-z-]. Identifiers MUST NOT be empty. Numeric identifiers MUST
128 // NOT include leading zeroes.
129 const std::string prerelease_pattern = "(-" + PRERELEASE_PATTERN + ")?";
130 const int PRERELEASE_INDEX = 6;
131
132 // 10. Build metadata MAY be denoted by appending a plus sign and a series of
133 // dot separated identifiers immediately following the patch or
134 // pre-release version. Identifiers MUST comprise only ASCII
135 // alphanumerics and hyphen [0-9A-Za-z-]. Identifiers MUST NOT be
136 // empty.
137 const std::string metadata_pattern = "(\\+" + METADATA_PATTERN + ")?";
138 const int METADATA_INDEX = 9;
139
140 const std::string grammar = std::string("^") + version_pattern + prerelease_pattern + metadata_pattern + "$";
141
142 std::regex version_grammar(grammar, std::regex_constants::extended);
143 std::smatch fragments;
144
145 if (!std::regex_match(v, fragments, version_grammar))
146 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid version: " + v);
147
148 return semver::version(parse_version(fragments[VERSION_INDEX].str()), fragments[PRERELEASE_INDEX].str(),
149 fragments[METADATA_INDEX].str());
150 }
151
152 version::version(std::vector<unsigned int> versions, std::string prerelease, std::string metadata)
153 : versions(std::move(versions)), prerelease(std::move(prerelease)), metadata(std::move(metadata))
154 {
155 if (this->versions.size() < 2)
156 throw std::invalid_argument("Version must contain at least two numbers.");
157
158 if (!this->prerelease.empty())
159 {
160 match_prerelease(this->prerelease);
161 parse_prerelease();
162 }
163
164 if (!this->metadata.empty())
165 {
166 match_metadata(this->metadata);
167 }
168 }
169
170 std::string version::str() const
171 {
172 std::string out = std::to_string(versions[0]);
173
174 for (size_t i = 1; i < versions.size(); ++i)
175 {
176 out += ".";
177 out += std::to_string(versions[i]);
178 }
179
180 if (!prerelease.empty())
181 {
182 out += "-";
183 out += prerelease;
184 }
185
186 if (!metadata.empty())
187 {
188 out += "+";
189 out += metadata;
190 }
191
192 return out;
193 }
194
195 version version::bump_major() const
196 {
197 return bump(0);
198 }
199
200 version version::bump_minor() const
201 {
202 return bump(1);
203 }
204
205 version version::bump_patch() const
206 {
207 return bump(2);
208 }
209
210 version version::bump(unsigned int index) const
211 {
212 std::vector<unsigned int> bumped_versions = versions;
213
214 if (index >= bumped_versions.size())
215 {
216 std::fill_n(std::back_inserter(bumped_versions), index - bumped_versions.size() + 1, 0);
217 bumped_versions[index] = 1;
218 }
219 else
220 {
221 bumped_versions[index] += 1;
222
223 for (size_t i = index + 1; i < bumped_versions.size(); ++i) bumped_versions[i] = 0;
224 }
225
226 return version(bumped_versions, prerelease, metadata);
227 }
228
229 std::vector<unsigned int> version::get_version() const
230 {
231 return versions;
232 }
233
234 std::string version::get_prerelease() const
235 {
236 return prerelease;
237 }
238
239 std::string version::get_metadata() const
240 {
241 return metadata;
242 }
243
244 version version::strip_prerelease() const
245 {
246 return version(versions, "", metadata);
247 }
248
249 version version::strip_metadata() const
250 {
251 return version(versions, prerelease, "");
252 }
253
254 bool version::is_release() const
255 {
256 return (prerelease.empty());
257 }
258
259 bool version::operator==(const version &v) const
260 {
261 return versions == v.versions && prerelease == v.prerelease;
262 }
263
264 bool version::operator<(const version &v) const
265 {
266 // Compare version numbers.
267 if (versions < v.versions)
268 return true;
269 if (versions > v.versions)
270 return false;
271
272 // Compare prerelease identifiers.
273 if (prerelease == v.prerelease)
274 return false;
275
276 // If either one, but not both, are release versions, release is greater.
277 if (is_release() ^ v.is_release())
278 return !is_release();
279
280 return prerelease_comp < v.prerelease_comp;
281 }
282
283 bool version::operator>(const version &v) const
284 {
285 return (v < *this);
286 }
287
288 unsigned int version::get_version(unsigned int index) const
289 {
290 if (index >= versions.size())
291 return 0;
292
293 return versions[index];
294 }
295
296 std::vector<unsigned int> parse_version(const std::string &v)
297 {
298 std::regex numbers("\\d+");
299 std::sregex_token_iterator first(v.begin(), v.end(), numbers);
300 std::sregex_token_iterator last;
301
302 std::vector<unsigned int> results;
303 std::for_each(first, last, [&results](std::string s) { results.push_back((unsigned int) std::stoul(s)); });
304
305 return results;
306 }
307
308 void version::parse_prerelease()
309 {
310 std::regex separator("\\.");
311 std::sregex_token_iterator first(prerelease.begin(), prerelease.end(), separator, -1);
312 std::sregex_token_iterator last;
313
314 std::for_each(first, last, [this](std::string s) {
315 check_identifier(s);
316
317 prerelease_comp.emplace_back(s);
318 });
319 }
320
321 void check_identifier(const std::string &s)
322 {
323 if (s.empty())
324 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid identifier: " + s);
325
326 if (s[0] != '0')
327 return;
328
329 for (size_t i = 1; i < s.size(); ++i)
330 {
331 if (!std::isdigit(s[i]))
332 return;
333 }
334
335 throw std::invalid_argument("Numerical identifier cannot contain leading zeroes.");
336 }
337
338 void match_prerelease(const std::string &s)
339 {
340 if (!std::regex_match(s, std::regex(PRERELEASE_PATTERN)))
341 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid prerelease: " + s);
342 }
343
344 void match_metadata(const std::string &s)
345 {
346 if (!std::regex_match(s, std::regex(METADATA_PATTERN)))
347 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid metadata: " + s);
348 }
349} // namespace semver
